All bonds trading at or ABOVE PAR (100-103)
Very strong CFFO of $772m in LTM
Capital-light rental model with recurring revenues
Deal priced tight despite top-line issues (Jul 2025)

credit_opinion.summary: Loxam is a performing credit with low distress score (12) and all bonds trading at or above par (100-103). The company is the European leader in equipment rental with strong EBITDA margins (~28%) and very strong CFFO generation ($772m). Net leverage of 4.5x is moderate. However, EBITDA is DECLINING with 3Q25 down -9.6% YoY and 2Q25 down -12.4% YoY, reflecting European construction slowdown. Net income has turned negative. Recent issuances at 4.25% demonstrate continued market access at tight spreads. Apr 2026 maturity ($336m) should be easily refinanced.

distress_indicators.trading_signals: All bonds at 100-103 (at/above par). Recent issuances at 4.25% - tight HY spreads. Low distress despite EBITDA headwinds. Market confidence in European equipment rental leader.
